paper_title.en: Development of mooring system to reduce long-period motions of a large ship
paper_title.ja: Development of mooring system to reduce long-period motions of a large ship

description.en: A unique mooring system has been developed to effectively reduce long-period motions (surge motions) of a large ship at a pier, caused by the resonance with long-period waves (periods: 30-300seconds). The object of system is to keep the natural period of the moored ship as far away from the predominant one of the waves as possible. In 2007-2010, the demonstration experiments were conducted in the port of Ishinomaki, Japan, and the numerical simulation method has been established to quantitatively evaluate the motions of the moored ship with the system. Copyright © 2011 by the International Society of Offshore and Polar Engineers (ISOPE).
